results.title: Whatever happened to Baby Jane?
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich and Seven Arts Productions
results.brief_description: Bette Davis plays Jane Hudson, an aging alcoholic whose vauderville career as child-star “Baby Jane” has faded to obscurity. Her sister Blanche (Jane Crawford) lived in Jane’s shadow as a girl but enjoyed a successful adult career as a glamourous film star until an “accident” left her wheelchair-bound. The aging sisters live alone in a gloomy Hollywood mansion, with Jane becoming increasingly eccentric and keeping Blanche a virtual prisoner. After a series of horrific incidents, the obsessive relationship between the two draws to a sinister conclusion. Based on the novel by Henry Farrell.

results.title: Whatever
results.creator_credit: Susan Skoog, Kevin Segalla, Michelle Yahn and Ellin Baumel
results.brief_description: ‘Whatever’ is a coming-of-age film set in the mundane suburbia of New Jersey in the early 1980s. Anna (Liza Weill) hopes she will never be ordinary. Her dream is to escape to an art school in New York. Brenda, (Chad Morgan) her best friend, is both an exciting companion and a destructive force. Together they explore sex, drugs and rock’n roll, their experiences often proving less than positive. Anna comes to realise that the road to adulthood can involve some hard decisions, and that friendships can’t always last forever. With a soundtrack that includes Blondie, The Ramones, Motorhead and The Patti Smith Group, ‘Whatever’ portrays a gritty slice of suburban teenage life.

results.title: What, where and when
results.creator_credit: Denis Shand and The Gan Council
results.brief_description: Sounds hints for housewives: How to buy fish and meat, what makes a balanced meal, using the fridge and storing vegetables, cooking utensils and various hints on all matters dealing with the work of the housewife in the kitchen. No 1 of a Cookery Series suitable for women’s groups and domestic science classes.

results.title: What you ought to want
results.brief_description: Bishop G. Bromley Oxnam addresses a group of young people on the subject, “How do you tell right from wrong?” He points to the basic facets in our heritage of history and of faith which can be used to measure the effects of choices one makes. He demonstrates ways in which the best of science, history, poetry, drama and religion can be brought to bear on decisions which may touch not only one’s own personality but those of others in the family, community, nation and world.

results.title: What women want [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Nancy Meyers, Matt Williams, Gina Matthews, Bruce Davey, Susan Cartonis, Centropolis Effects, Wind Dancer Productions, Paramount Pictures and ICON
results.brief_description: Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is a real ladies man. Raised by his mother, a Las Vegas showgirl, he has a somewhat distorted perception of what women really want, and an enormous ego. When he is passed over for an executive position in the advertising agency for a woman his chauvinistic attitude worsens. A freak accident while trying to brainstorm ideas for a new advertising campaign, leaves Nick with the ability to hear what women think. Amazed by his new talent Nick seeks the help of a therapist (Bette Midler) who suggests he think of it as a gift and not a curse, and to use this to his advantage. Nick sets his sights on Darcy McGuire (Helen Hunt), the new creative director in the agency. At first his plan works, and he undermines Darcy at every opportunity, until he realises Darcy has feelings for him, and that he feels the same way about her. Cast also includes Marisa Tomei, Mark Feurstein, Lauren Holly, Valerie Perrine, Delta Bourke and Alan Alda.

results.title: What Will Come (has already come)
results.brief_description: What Will Come (Has Already Come) (2007), a film seen in a cylindrical mirror on a table, is composed of revolving images – from familiar carousel animals through to tanks and aeroplanes.

constellations_other.name: Power and infamy
constellations_other.description: Beginning with an anamorphic image of Napoleon III, this Constellation focuses on representations of the distorted perspective of patriarchal power.

results.title: What we do at kindergarten
results.creator_credit: Pamela Eagles, Donn Clauscen, Dianne Milwright and Myles-Milwright Productions
results.brief_description: Shows daily activities in kindergartens emphasising the extent activities aid the preschool child’s development. Suitable for use with parents of kindergarten age children and for infant primary teachers as a background knowledge of what happens in kindergartens.
